us.ihmc.euclid.rotationConversion

Class QuaternionConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.rotationConversion.QuaternionConversion

  • public abstract class QuaternionConversion
extends java.lang.Object
    This class gathers all the methods necessary to converts any type of rotation into a quaternion.

    To convert an orientation into other data structure types see:

    • for axis-angle: AxisAngleConversion,
    • for rotation matrix: RotationMatrixConversion,
    • for rotation vector: RotationVectorConversion,
    • for yaw-pitch-roll: YawPitchRollConversion.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double EPS
      Tolerance used to identify various edge cases, such as to identify when an axis-angle represents a zero orientation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      • computeYawQuaternion

        public static final void computeYawQuaternion(double yaw,
                                              QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Sets the given quaternion to represent a counter clockwise rotation around the z-axis of an angle yaw.
        Parameters:
        yaw - the angle to rotate about the z-axis.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertAxisAngleToQuaternion

        public static final void convertAxisAngleToQuaternion(AxisAngleReadOnly axisAngle,
                                                      QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given axis-angle into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the axis-angle and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either component of the axis-angle is Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.
        • if the length of the axis is below EPS, the rotation matrix is set to the neutral quaternion.

        Parameters:
        axisAngle - the axis-angle to use for the conversion. Not modified.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertAxisAngleToQuaternion

        public static final void convertAxisAngleToQuaternion(double ux,
                                                      double uy,
                                                      double uz,
                                                      double angle,
                                                      QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given axis-angle into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the axis-angle and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either component of the axis-angle is Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.
        • if the length of the axis is below EPS, the rotation matrix is set to the neutral quaternion.

        Parameters:
        ux - the axis x-component of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        uy - the axis y-component of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        uz - the axis z-component of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        angle - the angle of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertMatrixToQuaternion

        public static void convertMatrixToQuaternion(RotationScaleMatrixReadOnly rotationScaleMatrix,
                                             QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given rotation part of the given rotation-scale matrix into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the rotation part of the rotation-scale matrix and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation matrix contains at least one Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        rotationScaleMatrix - a 3-by-3 matrix representing an orientation and a scale. Only the orientation part is used during the conversion. Not modified.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertMatrixToQuaternion

        public static void convertMatrixToQuaternion(RotationMatrixReadOnly rotationMatrix,
                                             QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given rotation matrix into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the rotation matrix and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation matrix contains at least one Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        rotationMatrix - a 3-by-3 matrix representing an orientation. Not modified.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertMatrixToQuaternion

        public static void convertMatrixToQuaternion(double m00,
                                             double m01,
                                             double m02,
                                             double m10,
                                             double m11,
                                             double m12,
                                             double m20,
                                             double m21,
                                             double m22,
                                             QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given rotation matrix into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the rotation matrix and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation matrix contains at least one Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        m00 - the 1st row 1st column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m01 - the 1st row 2nd column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m02 - the 1st row 3rd column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m10 - the 2nd row 1st column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m11 - the 2nd row 2nd column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m12 - the 2nd row 3rd column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m20 - the 3rd row 1st column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m21 - the 3rd row 2nd column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        m22 - the 3rd row 3rd column coefficient of the rotation matrix.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertRotationVectorToQuaternion

        public static void convertRotationVectorToQuaternion(Vector3DReadOnly rotationVector,
                                                     QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the rotation vector into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the rotation vector and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation vector contains at least a Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        WARNING: a rotation vector is different from a yaw-pitch-roll or Euler angles representation. A rotation vector is equivalent to the axis of an axis-angle that is multiplied by the angle of the same axis-angle.

        Parameters:
        rotationVector - the rotation vector to use in the conversion. Not modified.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertRotationVectorToQuaternion

        public static void convertRotationVectorToQuaternion(double rx,
                                                     double ry,
                                                     double rz,
                                                     QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the rotation vector into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the rotation vector and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation vector contains at least a Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        WARNING: a rotation vector is different from a yaw-pitch-roll or Euler angles representation. A rotation vector is equivalent to the axis of an axis-angle that is multiplied by the angle of the same axis-angle.

        Parameters:
        rx - the x-component of the rotation vector to use in the conversion.
        ry - the y-component of the rotation vector to use in the conversion.
        rz - the z-component of the rotation vector to use in the conversion.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertYawPitchRollToQuaternion

        public static void convertYawPitchRollToQuaternion(double[] yawPitchRoll,
                                                   QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given yaw-pitch-roll angles into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the yaw-pitch-roll and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either of the yaw, pitch, or roll angle is Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        Note: the yaw-pitch-roll representation, also called Euler angles, corresponds to the representation of an orientation by decomposing it by three successive rotations around the three axes: Z (yaw), Y (pitch), and X (roll). The equivalent rotation matrix of such representation is:
        R = RZ(yaw) * RY(pitch) * RX(roll)

        Parameters:
        yawPitchRoll - the yaw-pitch-roll angles to use in the conversion. Not modified.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.

      • convertYawPitchRollToQuaternion

        public static void convertYawPitchRollToQuaternion(double yaw,
                                                   double pitch,
                                                   double roll,
                                                   QuaternionBasics quaternionToPack)
        Converts the given yaw-pitch-roll angles into a quaternion.

        After calling this method, the yaw-pitch-roll and the quaternion represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either of the yaw, pitch, or roll angle is Double.NaN, the quaternion is set to Double.NaN.

        Note: the yaw-pitch-roll representation, also called Euler angles, corresponds to the representation of an orientation by decomposing it by three successive rotations around the three axes: Z (yaw), Y (pitch), and X (roll). The equivalent rotation matrix of such representation is:
        R = RZ(yaw) * RY(pitch) * RX(roll)

        Parameters:
        yaw - the yaw angle to use in the conversion.
        pitch - the pitch angle to use in the conversion.
        roll - the roll angle to use in the conversion.
        quaternionToPack - the quaternion in which the result is stored.
